BASIC_BATTING_FUNDAMENTALS.title: Basic Batting and Bowling Fundamentals
BASIC_BATTING_FUNDAMENTALS.description: Foundational cricket skills for absolute beginners based on standard international coaching principles

followup_questions.question: Do you have access to a cricket bat and a soft ball?
Where do you usually practice cricket?

batting_drills.name: Bat Grip (V-Grip)
batting_drills.what: The correct way to hold the cricket bat using both hands
how_to: Hold the bat vertically in front of you
Place your top hand on the handle
Your thumb and index finger should form a 'V'
The 'V' should point towards the inside edge of the bat
Place the bottom hand lightly below the top hand
common_mistakes: V pointing towards the outside edge
Using too much bottom hand power
batting_drills.why_it_matters: A correct grip gives better control, improves timing, and reduces injury risk

batting_drills.name: Batting Stance
batting_drills.what: The starting position of a batter before the ball is bowled
how_to: Stand side-on to the bowler
Keep feet shoulder-width apart
Bend knees slightly for balance
Keep head level and eyes facing the bowler
Rest the bat behind the back foot
batting_drills.why_it_matters: A good stance provides balance and helps play straight shots

batting_drills.name: Backlift
batting_drills.what: The movement of lifting the bat before playing a shot
how_to: Lift the bat smoothly as the bowler approaches
Keep hands relaxed
Bat face slightly open
Avoid jerky or rushed movements
common_mistakes: Bat too far behind the body
batting_drills.why_it_matters: A relaxed backlift improves timing and shot control

batting_drills.name: Defensive Block Shot
batting_drills.what: A basic shot used to stop the ball safely
how_to: Step forward towards the ball
Keep the bat straight
Meet the ball under the eyes
Soft hands to drop the ball near your feet
batting_drills.why_it_matters: Teaches control and builds confidence against bowling

batting_drills.name: Straight Drive
batting_drills.what: A front-foot shot played along the ground
how_to: Step forward with the front foot
Keep head over the ball
Swing the bat straight down
Finish with the bat pointing towards the bowler
batting_drills.why_it_matters: Develops timing, balance, and straight bat technique

bowling_drills.name: Basic Bowling Grip
bowling_drills.what: Correct way to hold the cricket ball for overarm bowling
how_to: Place index and middle fingers on top of the seam
Thumb rests lightly underneath the ball
Do not squeeze the ball tightly
bowling_drills.why_it_matters: Correct grip allows better control and smooth release

bowling_drills.name: Short Run-Up Bowling
bowling_drills.what: A safe and controlled way to begin bowling
how_to: Use a short run-up of 4 to 6 steps
Start with walking or gentle jogging
Focus on smooth movement, not speed
bowling_drills.why_it_matters: Helps beginners learn action safely without injury risk

bowling_drills.name: Basic Overarm Action
how_to: Raise the front arm towards the target
Rotate shoulders smoothly
Release the ball in front of the body
Follow through naturally
bowling_drills.why_it_matters: Builds correct bowling mechanics and prevents injuries

safety_rules: Use only a soft ball for beginners
Avoid fast or long bowling spells
Focus on technique rather than power
Stop training if pain or discomfort occurs
